results.title: Henry V: the Battle of Agincourt [study extract]
results.brief_description: Vividly presents the Battle of Agincourt, from Henry V by Shakespeare. The study extract shows the preparations for, and the actual fighting by, both infantry and cavalry with all its noise, colour and confusion.

results.title: Henry V [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, Bruce Sharman, BBC and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Henry V, young king of medieval England, roused his troops to arms against a French army five times greater than themselves. His life and leadership was legendary. From the above story, William Shakespeare wrote one of his greatest plays. Kenneth Branagh, whose stage portrayal of Henry V has been world-acclaimed, made his film directorial debut with this film. Also starring Paul Scofield, Derek Jacobi, Judi Dench and Christian Bale, the film loses none of the power and beauty of Shakespeare’s text.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Branagh, Bruce Sharman, BBC and Renaissance Films

results.title: Henry V
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. He defeats a vastly larger French army at Agincourt (1415), wins the hand of the French Princess Catherine of Valois, and is recognised as the heir to the French throne.

results.title: Henry Moore
results.brief_description: An analysis of the work of the British sculptor, Henry Moore, and an interview with the artist himself. The film shows, in detail, a number of examples of his work and then follows all stages in the creation of a bronze statue commissioned for the Festival of Britain.

results.title: Henry Ford 1863-1947
results.brief_description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.
results.description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Janet Leissner, Roman Kroitor, Paul Wright and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.
